meanings.definition: Small, flat, thin pieces of something
meanings.sent1: The snowflakes gently fell from the sky.
meanings.sent2: She brushed off the pastry flakes from her shirt.
meanings.sent3: The cereal flakes danced in the bowl as he poured milk over them.
meanings.sent4: The flakes of paint on the old wall revealed layers of history.
meanings.sent5: The flakes of coconut added a crunchy texture to the dessert.

meanings.definition: A person who is unreliable or eccentric
meanings.sent1: He's such a flakes, always changing his mind at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The boss couldn't rely on the flakes to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The party planner turned out to be a real flakes, showing up with a llama instead of decorations.
meanings.sent4: She's a real flakes, like a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The flakes in the group meeting always had wild ideas that surprised everyone.

meanings.definition: To come off in small, flat, thin pieces
meanings.sent1: The old paint flakes off the walls with each passing year.
meanings.sent2: She carefully flakes the chocolate to decorate the cake.
meanings.sent3: The dry skin on his heels flakes off after using moisturizer.
meanings.sent4: As the sunburn heals, the skin begins to flakes away.
meanings.sent5: The bark of the tree flakes off in the autumn, revealing the smooth trunk underneath.
